section.para: The component supports arithmetic, relational, and equality operations on integer literals (without suffixes) ranging from 0 to .

occurs when an operation attempts to decrease a 0 value or increase a value. In both cases, the decrease or increase becomes an identity--i.e. an attempt to decrease 0, such as
(0)
results in 0, and an attempt to increase , such as
()
results in .

The predicate can be used to test whether an integer literal is in range (i.e. is greater than or equal to 0 and less than or equal to ).
(23) // 1 (1000000) // 0
It should be reinforced that the facilities operate on integer literals (without suffixes), not integral constant expressions such as a + b.

The following table summarizes the arithmetic operations and their equivalents in C or C++:
(x, y) x + y > ? : x + y
(x) x - 1 < 0 ? 0 : x - 1
(x, y) x / y
(x) x + 1 > ? : x + 1
(x, y) x * y > ? : x * y
(x, y) x % y
(x, y) x - y < 0 ? 0 : x - y

The following table summarizes the equality and relational operations and their equivalents in C or C++.
(x, y)x == y
(x, y)x > y
(x, y)x >= y
(x, y)x < y
(x, y)x <= y
(x, y)x != y
